elements.description:
Headers form item.

Provides UI to enter headers data and autocomplete function for both header
names and values.

properties.name: model
properties.description: View model for the headers.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this element.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of this element.

properties.name: narrow
properties.description: If set it renders a narrow layout

properties.name: docsOpened
properties.description: True to render documentation (if set in model)

properties.name: isCustom
properties.description:
Set if the header is not specified in the RAML type (is a custom
header).

properties.name: isArray
properties.description:
If set it is render the item control as an array item (adds more
spacing to the element)

properties.name: _valueSuggestions
properties.description:
List of value suggestion for current header. The list is updated
automatically when header name changes

properties.name: _valueInput
properties.description: Reference to header value input.

properties.name: _nameInput
properties.description: Reference to the name input field

properties.name: required
properties.description: True when this model is required

properties.name: _nameSuggestionsOpened
properties.description: True when suggestions popover is opened

properties.name: noDocs
properties.description:
Prohibits rendering of the documentation (the icon and the
description).
Note, Set is separately for `api-view-model-transformer`
component as this only affects "custom" items.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: When set the editor is in read only mode.

methods.name: toggleDocs
methods.description: Toggles documentation (if available)

methods.name: _headerNameFocus
methods.description: Handler for header name field focus

methods.name: _onHeaderNameSelected
methods.description: A handler called when the user selects a suggestion.

methods.name: _queryHeaderName
methods.description: Handler for autocomplete element. Query the datastore for suggestions.

methods.name: _queryHeaderNameSuggestions
methods.description:
Dispatches `query-headers` custom event to retreive from the application
headers definition.

`api-headers-form` element contains `arc-definitions` element that
listens for this event.

methods.name: _nameChanged
methods.description: Updates value suggestions for custom values.

methods.name: _customChangeFocus
methods.description:
Handler for custom value focus event.
Sets the `_valueInput` proeprty for value autosugession

methods.name: _updateValueAutocomplete
methods.description:
Updates header value autocomplete if header definition contains
the `autocomplete` entry. It only sets the autocomplete value when
only one header has been found for current input.

params.name: headers
params.description: List of received headers from headers query

methods.name: _updateHeaderDocs
methods.description:
Updates header description if the header doesn't contain a description
already.

methods.name: _onHeaderValueSelected
methods.description: A handler called when the user selects a value suggestion.

methods.name: _closeAutocomplete
methods.description: Closes autocomplete for value when inpur looses focus.

elements.description:
HTTP headers form build from AMF json/ld model.
The form is pre-populated with predefined values from the AMF model
using `api-view-model-transformer` element. This element is included in
`api-headers-editor`.

**This API component replaces `raml-headers-form` component**. Old
component uses RAML data model generated by raml JS parser only.
If you need RAML form only or component that works with Polymer 1.0
use `raml-headers-form` instead.

## Building the view model

For practical reasons this element consumes different data model than the
one used in AMF. Use `api-view-model-transformer` element to generate
data view model from AMF JSON ld schema. See demo page for example of
use.

### Generating view model from AMF

```html
<api-view-model-transformer on-view-model-changed="_updateView"></api-view-model-transformer>
<api-headers-form model="{{viewModel}}" value="{{headers}}"></api-headers-form>
<script>
const amfModel = getAmfFromRamlOrOas();
const processor = document.querySelector('api-view-model-transformer');
if (amfModel['@context']) {
 processor.amfContext = amfModel['@context'];
}
processor.amfModel = extractHeadersForMethod(amfModel);
processor.addEventListener('view-model-changed', (e) => {
 document.querySelector('api-headers-form') = e.detail.value;
});
< /script>
```

This example uses `getAmfFromRamlOrOas()` function where you implement
the logic of getting AMF json/ld data. It can be stored in file or parsed
using AMF parsers. The `extractHeadersForMethod()` function implements a
logic of extracting headers definition from a method (for example).

### Manually generating view model

You can use `api-view-model-transformer` and `buildProperty()` function
to generate basic view model. You can also construct it on your own.
See `api-view-model-transformer` element documentation for model schema.

## Changes in v2

The component won't listen for `headers-value-changed` custom event.
Components / applications using this element should handle headers change
event in the application and generate new model for the view.
Setting `value` makes no effect on the element. Only way to change
generated UI is to change the model.

## Styling

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--api-headers-form` | Mixin applied to this element | `{}`
`--api-headers-form-delete-icon-margin-top` | Margin top of the delete button | `16px`
`--api-headers-form-delete-icon-margin-top-narrow` | Margin top of the delete button in narrow layout | `16px`
`--api-headers-form-enable-checkbox-margin-top` | Margin top of the enable checkbox | `32px`
`--api-headers-form-enable-checkbox-margin-top` | Margin top of the enable checkbox in narrow layout | `32px`
`--api-headers-form-item` | Mixin applied to each form item. Each for item is separate element. | `{}`
`--api-headers-editore-hint-icon-margin-top` | Margin top of help icon. | `16px`
`--api-headers-editore-hint-icon-margin-top-narrow` | Margin top of help icon in narrow layout. | `16px`
`--api-headers-form-name-input` | Mixin applied to header name input | `{}`
`--api-headers-form-name-input-narrow` | Mixin applied to header name input in narrow layout | `{}`
`--api-headers-form-array-parameter` | Mixin applied to the value input when the input is an array | `{}`

See `api-headers-form-item` and `api-form-mixin/api-form-styles` for more styling API.

properties.name: model
properties.description: View model to use to render the form.

properties.name: optionalOpened
properties.description: Set to true to show optional parameters (not required by the API).

properties.name: hasOptional
properties.description:
Computed value from `allowHideOptional` and view model.
`true` if current model has any optional property.

properties.name: allowHideOptional
properties.description:
If set it computes `hasOptional` property and shows checkbox in the
form to show / hide optional properties.

properties.name: renderOptionalCheckbox
properties.description: Computed flag to determine if optional checkbox can be rendered

properties.name: allowDisableParams
properties.description:
If set, enable / disable param checkbox is rendered next to each
form item.

properties.name: allowCustom
properties.description:
When set, renders "add custom" item button.
If the element is to be used withouth AMF model this should always
be enabled. Otherwise users won't be able to add a parameter.

properties.name: narrow
properties.description: Renders items in "narrow" view

properties.name: renderEmptyMessage
properties.description:
Computed value. The form renders empty message (if supported by
the form element). It occurs when model is not set and allowCustom
is not set

properties.name: value
properties.description:
Current value of the headers. Changing the value will update the list
of the headers.

properties.name: noDocs
properties.description:
Prohibits rendering of the documentation (the icon and the
description).
Note, Set is separately for `api-view-model-transformer`
component as this only affects "custom" items.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: When set the editor is in read only mode.

methods.name: computeFormRowClass
methods.description: Computes class name for each form item depending on the item state.

params.name: optionalOpened
params.description: True if optional parameters are rendered.

methods.name: toggleOptionalParams
methods.description: Toggles visibility of optional parameters.

methods.name: _getForm
methods.description:
Returns a reference to the form element, if the DOM is ready.
This only works with `iron-form` that is in the DOM.

return.desc:
Iron form element. It may be `undefined` if local
DOM is not yet initialized.

methods.name: serializeForm
methods.description: Link to the form's serialize function.

return.desc:
Serialized form values or `undefined` if DOM is not ready.
Note, `undefined` is returned **only** if DOM is not yet ready.

methods.name: _computeHasOptionalParameters
methods.description:
Computes if any of the parameters are required.
It iterates over the model to find any first element that has `required`
propeerty set to `false`.

params.name: allowHideOptional
params.description:
State of `allowHideOptional` property.
If `false` this function always returns `false`.

params.name: record
params.description:
Change record. Note, it does not checks for
optional parameters each time the model changes. It rescans the model
when splices changed.

return.desc: `true` if model has at leas one alement that is not required.

methods.name: _computeRenderCheckbox
methods.description: Computes value for `renderOptionalCheckbox` property.

methods.name: _computeIsCustom
methods.description:
Computes if given model item is a custom property (not generated by
AMF model transformation).

return.desc:
`true` if `isCustom` property is set on model's schema
property.

methods.name: addCustom
methods.description:
Adds empty custom property to the list.

It dispatches `api-property-model-build` custom event that is handled by
`api-view-model-transformer` to build model item.
This assumem that the transformer element is already in the DOM.

After the transformation the element pushes or sets the data to the
`model`.

params.name: opts
params.description:
Additional options:
- inputLabel {String} - Forces a label of the input

methods.name: _removeCustom
methods.description:
Removes custom item from the UI.
This can only be called from `dom-repeat` element so it contain's
`model` property.

methods.name: computeIsOptional
methods.description:
Computes if model item is optional.
The items is always optional if is not required and when `hasOptional`
is set to `true`.

return.desc: `true` if the model item is optional in the form.

methods.name: _computeRenderEmptyMessage
methods.description: Computes value for `renderEmptyMessage`.

params.name: allowCustom
params.description: True if the form allows to add custom values.

return.desc: `true` when allowCustom is falsy set and model is empty

methods.name: add
methods.description: Appends an empty header to the list.

methods.name: _updateValue
methods.description: Updates value of the element when model change.

params.name: validate
params.description:
When true then it performs validation after setting
the value.

methods.name: __updateValue
methods.description: Creates a header value for current model.

params.name: validate
params.description:
When true then it performs validation after setting
the value.

methods.name: _autoDescribeModel
methods.description: Adds documentation for headers that doesn't have it already.

methods.name: _fillModelDescription
methods.description: Queries for header information and updates header info if needed.

params.name: index
params.description: Position of the item in `model` array

methods.name: _queryHeaderData
methods.description: Queries for a header definition.

elements.name: ApiHeadersForm

attributes.description: View model to use to render the form.

attributes.name: optional-opened
attributes.description: Set to true to show optional parameters (not required by the API).

attributes.name: has-optional
attributes.description:
Computed value from `allowHideOptional` and view model.
`true` if current model has any optional property.

attributes.name: allow-hide-optional
attributes.description:
If set it computes `hasOptional` property and shows checkbox in the
form to show / hide optional properties.

attributes.description: Computed flag to determine if optional checkbox can be rendered

attributes.name: allow-disable-params
attributes.description:
If set, enable / disable param checkbox is rendered next to each
form item.

attributes.name: allow-custom
attributes.description:
When set, renders "add custom" item button.
If the element is to be used withouth AMF model this should always
be enabled. Otherwise users won't be able to add a parameter.

attributes.name: narrow
attributes.description: Renders items in "narrow" view

attributes.name: render-empty-message
attributes.description:
Computed value. The form renders empty message (if supported by
the form element). It occurs when model is not set and allowCustom
is not set

Current value of the headers. Changing the value will update the list

attributes.description:
Prohibits rendering of the documentation (the icon and the

Note, Set is separately for `api-view-model-transformer`
component as this only affects "custom" items.
